Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • components.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Board.Position
      Class that represents Positions on the Board.
      class  Board.Row
      Class Row that holds a set of blocks that represent a row on the board.
      static class  Board.RowOrientation
      Enumeration that can be used to indicate in what direction a set of stones is oriented.

    • Field Detail

      • openPositions

        private java.util.ArrayList<Board.Position> openPositions
        List that holds all the positions that are open. Open means that it is a valid location to place a block.

      • filledPositions

        private java.util.Map<Board.Position,Block> filledPositions
        List that holds all the filled positions. The filled positions have a Position and a Block.

      • xLow

        private int xLow
        For each bound a integer that indicates the size of the current field.

      • xHigh

        private int xHigh
        For each bound a integer that indicates the size of the current field.

      • yLow

        private int yLow
        For each bound a integer that indicates the size of the current field.

      • yHigh

        private int yHigh
        For each bound a integer that indicates the size of the current field.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructs a Board and initializes the openPositions List and the filledPositions map. It also opens the starting point of the Board

    • Method Detail

      • fill

        public boolean fill(Board.Position p,
           Block b)
        Fills the given position with the given Block. Also opens up new positions according to the given position.
        Parameters:
        p - the position where the block will be put
        b - the Block that will be added to the Board

      • updateBounds

        private void updateBounds(Board.Position p)
        Updates the bounds according to the position p.
        Parameters:
        p - the Position from where will be expanded

      • openNewPositions

        private void openNewPositions(Board.Position p)
        Opens the positions next to position p
        Parameters:
        p - the Position from where will be expanded.

      • openNewPositions

        private void openNewPositions(Board.Position p,
                    java.util.List<Board.Position> pos)
        Opens all adjecent Positions into the given list.
        Parameters:
        p - the central postion
        pos - the list in which the positions will be opened.

      • openPositionIn

        private void openPositionIn(Board.Position p,
                  java.util.List<Board.Position> pos)
        The position that will be opened. Opening can happen in the global openPositions list or in an external list.
        Parameters:
        p - the Position that will be opened
        pos - the list in which the position will be opened

      • openPosition

        private void openPosition(Board.Position p)
        Open a position in the default List openPositions.
        Parameters:
        p - the Position that will be opened

      • connectedToFilledPositions

        private boolean connectedToFilledPositions(java.util.List<Board.Position> positions)
        Check if a given list of positions are connected to the Board by creating an empty list and passing it to checkNextPosition.
        Parameters:
        positions - the list with the positions that will be checked
        Returns:
        wether the possitions are connected to the main board

      • checkNextPosition

        private boolean checkNextPosition(java.util.List<Board.Position> positions,
                        java.util.List<Board.Position> freePositions)
        Check if a given list of positions are connected to the Board. The positions can be connected in several ways. At first all positions can be directly connected to the filledPositions on the board. Secondly the positions can be connected to the Board via the other Positions in the given List. But also a combination of these two is possible.
        Parameters:
        positions - the positions that are checked
        Returns:
        wether the possitions are connected to the main board

      • getCreatingRows

        public java.util.List<Board.Row> getCreatingRows(PlayBlocksMove m,
                                        Board.RowOrientation ro)
        Creates a List of Row objects that represent all the individual rows that will be expanded or created by executing PlayBlocksMove m.
        Parameters:
        m - the move that will create the rows
        ro - the orientation in which the PlayBlockMove blocks are oriented
        Returns:
        A List of Rows that the move will create or expand

      • determineRow

        private Board.Row determineRow(Board.Position base,
                     Board.RowOrientation ro)
        Creates a Row from the base in the Orientation ro, without an external list from which blocks can be used.
        Parameters:
        base - the position from where to start
        ro - in which orientation the returned row needs to be
        Returns:
        A new Row based on the orientation and the base position

      • determineRow

        private Board.Row determineRow(Board.Position base,
                     Board.RowOrientation ro,
                     PlayBlocksMove moveRow)
        Creates a Row from the base in the Orientation ro, the blocks can come from the filledPositions List or from the blocks in the PlayBlocksMove moveRow
        Parameters:
        base - the Position from where to start
        ro - in which orientation the returned row needs to be
        moveRow - the PlayBlocksMove from where blocks can be used to create the row
        Returns:
        A new Row based on the orientation, base position and the new blocks.

      • determineNextPosition

        private Board.Position determineNextPosition(Board.Position now,
                                   Board.RowOrientation ro,
                                   int diff)
        Returns the following position based on the current Position, the orientation and the difference.
        Parameters:
        now - the current Position
        ro - the orientation in which the nextPosition is selected
        diff - the distance that the current Position is away from the next Position
        Returns:
        the new position

      • isPerfectSquare

        public boolean isPerfectSquare()
        Checks if the board is a PerfectSquare which would mean that the game got stuck and must be ended.
        Returns:
        if the field is a perfectSquare

      • validRow

        public boolean validRow(Board.Row row)
        Validates if a given row follows the rules of the game. Such that there are only unique blocks in the row. All the blocks have the same shape or the same color.
        Parameters:
        row - the to be validated row
        Returns:
        whether the row is valid or not

      • toTUIString

        public java.lang.String toTUIString()
        Converts the Board into a TUI usable String using the shortstrings form Block to represent blocks.
        Returns:
        string that represents the Board in a textual way.

      • getOpenPositions

        public java.util.List<Board.Position> getOpenPositions()
        returns a list of the open Positions on the board
        Returns:
